articleContent.title: Chord: Minor 6th in G# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Minor 6th Chord in G# (Shape: C)

A Minor 6th chord in the key of G# using the C shape is formed by combining the notes G#, B#, D#, E#.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B# (Minor 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (6th)

## Musical Characteristics
The Minor 6th chord in G# adds a melancholic and emotional flavor to the music. It can create a sense of longing or introspection due to the combination of the minor tonality with the added color of the 6th.

## Genre and Usage
The Minor 6th chord is commonly used in jazz, blues, and soul music. It can evoke a sense of sophistication and complexity in these genres and is often used in ballads and slow tempo songs to convey deep emotions.

## Songs
1. "Autumn Leaves" by Nat King Cole
2. "Georgia on My Mind" by Ray Charles
3. "Feeling Good" by Nina Simone
